data.name: Email Security.cloud
data.description: "Email Security.cloud" is a product working in combination with "Symantec Messaging Gateway" as part of a range of services offered by Broadcom, headquartered in California. It features spam filtering, firewall protection, and block lists with resource guides of detailed troubleshooting steps for email delivery. Additionally, a legitimate email which has been incorrectly given a verdict of spam can be submitted to Symantec for analysis and filter review.

codes.description: The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

responses.response: smtp;450 Requested action aborted [9] #-#, please visit https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article?legacyId=TECH246726 for more details about this error message.

codes.description: The transaction failed permanently. The server will not try to send the message again.

responses.response: smtp;553 Message filtered. Refer to the Troubleshooting page at http://www.symanteccloud.com/troubleshooting for more information. (#5.7.1)

smtp;553 you are trying to use me [xx.messagelabs.com] as a relay, but I have not been configured to let you [x.xx.xx.xx, example.com] do this. Please visit www.symanteccloud.com/troubleshooting for more details about this error message and instructions to resolve this issue. (#5.7.1)

codes.description:
The transaction failed permanently. The server will not try to send the message again. This is used as a general error code, so there are many reasons why you could be seeing it.

Itâ€™s common for email service providers to add a status code (5.1.1) after the SMTP reply code (smtp;550) for additional categorization of the issue.

otherProviders.name: Mimecast
otherProviders.description: Mimecast is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution for promoted for businesses, headquartered in London. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Mimecast (*.mimecast.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as spam policy levels and overrides (allow lists).

otherProviders.name: Trend Micro
otherProviders.description: Trend Micro is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution for promoted for businesses, headquartered in Tokyo. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Trend Micro (example: *.trendmicro.com). The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as spam policy levels and overrides (allow lists).

otherProviders.name: Proofpoint
otherProviders.description: Proofpoint is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Proofpoint (*.ppe-hosted.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such a allow lists and spam filtering policy levels. For globally-blocked IPs, the adminstrator of the IP will need to request delisting directly.

otherProviders.name: Barracuda
otherProviders.description: Barracuda is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Barracuda before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as allow lists, but sender reputation issues that affect all Barracuda customers globally may require contacting Barracuda support directly to resolve.

otherProviders.name: ZeroSpam
otherProviders.description: ZeroSpam is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in Quebec. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by ZeroSpam before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as allow lists, but senders may also be able to contact a postmaster@zerospam.com and abuse@zerospam.com address to get more in-depth analysis.

otherProviders.name: Cisco
otherProviders.description: Cisco Secure Email is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Cisco (iphmx.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such a allow lists, so it helps to ask the recipient to run the described debugging tests in Cisco's User Guide to identify and resolve delivery issues.

otherProviders.name: FireEye
otherProviders.description: FireEye is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution promoted for businesses. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by FireEye before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such a allow lists, so it helps to ask the recipient to run the described debugging tests in the user guide to identify and resolve delivery issues.

otherProviders.name: Exchange Online Protection
otherProviders.description: Exchange Online Protection (EOP) is the spam filter for Microsoft 365, the business productivity suite from Microsoft. It provides businesses with spam filtering, block lists, and firewall protection. If a message is going to spam or getting blocked, there are typically instructions for the email admin to fix the specific error in Exchange documentation.
